meanings.definition: The act or process of building up.
meanings.sent1: The buildup of the sandcastle took hours to complete.
meanings.sent2: The buildup of excitement before the concert was palpable.
meanings.sent3: The buildup of anticipation for the surprise party was worth the wait.
meanings.sent4: The buildup of emotions inside her was like a volcano about to erupt.
meanings.sent5: The buildup of tension in the room made everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: An accumulation or increase, especially of something negative.
meanings.sent1: The buildup of trash in the alley was becoming a problem.
meanings.sent2: The buildup of stress from work was taking a toll on her health.
meanings.sent3: The buildup of complaints from customers made the manager rethink their strategy.
meanings.sent4: The buildup of resentment between them was like a dark cloud hanging over their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The buildup of negativity in the news was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: A gradual increase or growth in intensity or volume.
meanings.sent1: The buildup of suspense in the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent2: The buildup of traffic during rush hour made the commute longer.
meanings.sent3: The buildup of laughter in the room was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The buildup of energy in the stadium was electrifying.
meanings.sent5: The buildup of excitement in the crowd was infectious.
